Darklight is a demonbane weapon created from the sword Silverlight during the Shadow of the Storm quest. In that quest, it is transformed into Darklight after being used to destroy the demon Agrith-Naar, which coats it in his ichor. In addition, being that it is still made of silver, it is effective against vampyres.

Both Silverlight and Darklight can be mounted on the wall of a Quest Hall in a player-owned house at 42 Construction.

If lost, Darklight can be repurchased from Sir Prysin in Varrock Palace for 1,000 coins.

Note: Darklight can only be replaced if all Silverlights are dropped.

Passive effect[edit | edit source]

Against non-demonic enemies, Darklight is a fairly weak weapon with bonuses equivalent to that of a steel longsword. When using Darklight to fight standard demons, boss demons, or vampyres, the player's maximum hit is increased to approximately the same level as a dragon longsword; however, its accuracy remains the same.

Special attack[edit | edit source]

A player performing the darklight's special attack, Weaken.

Darklight has a special attack, Weaken, which consumes 50% of the player's special attack energy and lowers the opponent's Strength, Attack, and Defence levels by 5% (10% for demons) of their max level. This special is only activated when the player hits accurately and multiple special attacks will stack.[1]

Upgrading[edit | edit source]

The Darklight can be upgraded into the Arclight by using three ancient shards on the Altar in the centre of the Catacombs of Kourend. Doing so further increases the effectiveness against demons and changes attack speed to 4. Attempting to use Ancient shards on Darklight, without being at the altar in the centre of the Catacombs of Kourend will result in a message stating: "You require additional power from the catacombs altar to create Arclight".

75 Attack is required to wield the Arclight.

[[File:Darklight detail.png|left|150px]]
'''Darklight''' is a [[demonbane weapon]] created from the sword [[Silverlight]] during the [[Shadow of the Storm]] quest. In that quest, it is transformed into Darklight after being used to destroy the demon [[Agrith-Naar]], which coats it in his {{WP|ichor}}. In addition, being that it is still made of silver, it is effective against [[vampyre]]s.

Both [[Silverlight]] and Darklight can be [[Darklight (mounted)|mounted]] on the wall of a [[Quest Hall]] in a [[player-owned house]] at 42 [[Construction]].

If lost, Darklight can be repurchased from [[Sir Prysin]] in Varrock Palace for 1,000 coins.

'''Note: Darklight can only be replaced if all Silverlights are dropped.'''

==Passive effect==
Against non-demonic enemies, Darklight is a fairly weak weapon with bonuses equivalent to that of a [[steel longsword]]. When using Darklight to fight [[Demons#Standard|standard demons]], [[Demons#Boss|boss demons]], or [[vampyres]], the player's maximum hit is increased to approximately the same level as a [[dragon longsword]]; however, its accuracy remains the same.

==Special attack==
[[File:Weaken (special attack).gif|thumb|250px|A player performing the darklight's special attack, ''Weaken''.]]
Darklight has a [[special attack]], ''Weaken'', which consumes 50% of the player's special attack energy and lowers the opponent's [[Strength]], [[Attack]], and [[Defence]] levels by 5% (10% for demons) of their max level. This special is only activated when the player hits accurately and multiple special attacks '''will''' stack.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/527028885968683008|date=28 October 2014|archiveurl=https://archive.is/gwUpF|archivedate=26 May 2020|quote=Darklight: Drains Attack, Defence and Strength by 10% for demons or by 5% for other NPCs and players.}}

==Upgrading==
The [[Darklight]] can be upgraded into the [[Arclight]] by using three [[ancient shard]]s on the Altar in the centre of the [[Catacombs of Kourend]]. Doing so further increases the effectiveness against demons and changes attack speed to 4. Attempting to use [[Ancient shard|Ancient shards]] on [[Darklight]], without being at the altar in the centre of the [[Catacombs of Kourend]] will result in a message stating: "You require additional power from the catacombs altar to create [[Arclight]]".

75 Attack is required to wield the Arclight.
